com.camerontec.util.collection

Interface IByteArrayStore

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, IVersionedSizedStore
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IPersistentByteArrayStore
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AsynchronousPersistentByteArrayStore, DistributedByteArrayStore, ExternallyIndexedJournalingPersistentStore, HighCapacityIndexedJournalingPersistentStore, IndexedJournalingPersistentStore, InMemoryIndexingJournalingPersistentStore, JournalingPersistentStoreBase, LockingPersistentByteArrayStoreDecorator, MappedJournalingPersistentStore, SyncingAndLockingByteArrayStoreDecorator

    public interface IByteArrayStore
extends IVersionedSizedStore, Closeable
    Interface to be implemented by classes capable of storing collections of byte arrays.

    The characteristics of the underlying store are completely implementation dependent.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler
      Instances of this interface are recipients for iterations over the keys in a store.
      static class  IByteArrayStore.ReadRequest
      Read request specification for retrieving values from the store.
      static class  IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest
      Write request specification for modifying the store.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

    • Method Detail

      • read

        int read(IByteArrayStore.ReadRequest readRequest,
         BytesSegment value)
        Submit a read request to the store.
        Parameters:
        readRequest - The read request.
        value - the bytes segment to read into, starting at offset 0 (which means that any pre-existing data in the segment is not preserved)
        Returns:
        The value length in bytes

      • read

        int read(IByteArrayStore.ReadRequest readRequest,
         BytesSegment target,
         boolean isRandomAccess)
        Submit a read request to the store. This is a lower-level variant of read(ReadRequest, BytesSegment) allowing clients to specify whether this request is performed as a random-access operation or is part of a traversal of the collection, in which case the store implementation may be able to perform some optimizations (like caching I/O operations for example).
        Parameters:
        readRequest - The read request.
        target - the bytes segment to read into.
        isRandomAccess - true if this is a random-access read, false if this is a traversal read.
        Returns:
        The value length in bytes.

      • write

        void write(IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest writeRequest)
        Submit a write request to the store.

        In this context a write request is any request which seeks to modify the contents of the store.

        Parameters:
        writeRequest - The write request.

      • keys

        void keys(IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler handler)
        Iterates through the keys in the store.
        Parameters:
        handler - iteration handler. Method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) in this handler is called in turn for each key in the store. The iteration can be stopped at any time by having method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) return false.
